Yep, _ediz_ is correct.  Sure it might look good on PC, and hopefully better once Directx 11 is added in the patch as promised (its Directx 9 only at the moment), but it is a cross platform game and as such, the slowest platform is always considered.

Instead of making a extremely brilliant game for PC, then culling effect and textures etc to the point where it can run on Xbox 360/PS3, they make a game for Xbox 360/PS3, and rely on the engine to make it look better for PC.

The result of this is the game is always not as good as it could have been on PC, even if the developers do what they say they've done and spent time on the PC version.

32-bit programs are limited to 2gb of memory, unless they are large address aware in which case their limit is 3gb.  The game doesn't have a 64-bit version because the game doesn't use this much.  

A 32-bit game will still be faster under 64-bit (x64) windows as long as there is enough memory, but a 64-bit version, particularly one that is optimised, will always be faster than its 32-bit counterpart.  If it isn't, its a result of bad coding and not the fact its 64-bit.  Compared to the original game Crysis 2 is already a bit of a disappointment on PC (hopefully Directx 11 addition later can make up for that), just like Mafia 2 was a big disappointment because it was crippled by the limitations of consoles (and was only Directx 9).  

I paid for the original Crysis and was quite happy to do so, but I'm not paying for a game that has been crippled just because consoles wouldn't be able to run it otherwise, and I think a lot of people feel the same way.

Anti Piracy!
Game piracy is growing more and more as the years go on. As technology and the economy changes,
gaming companies are seeing a higher rate in piracy than ever. Especially in the PC and PSP side
of gaming. In these areas two groups and one person stand out more than any others they are SKiDROW,
RELOADED ( whom are the top PC game crackers/uploaders ) and the one known as KloWn ( whom is known
widely in the PSP ( Playstation Portable ) piracy world as the top PSP game cracker/uploader. While
the true identity of these persons is unknown anti-piracy groups have come closer to locating these
individuals and have even narrowed it down to the country where these individuals are located. And
this will come as the biggest shocker of all, they are all located in the United States Of America.

SKiDROW & RELOADED - These two particular groups have been in the PC piracy world since 1992. They are
greatly " respected " in the gaming piracy world as the top PC game crackers. They consist of
multiple members each of whom have a certain task to get the latest games uploaded. While these individuals
do not themselves distribute these games to these torrent/direct download sites we know they use IRC ( internet
chat relay ) channels to distribute this material and let other people do the rest. They have been known to
even crack Steam related games to be playable on their servers. While gaming companies continue to try everything
in their power to stop these groups with new protection and even go as far as making games require a online key
these two groups have proven they can not and will not stop their efforts to pirate every PC game that they can
get their hands on which makes them the most wanted pirates on the PC gaming side of the internet.
Anti-piracy groups work day and night to find the true identity of these individuals and exactly where they
are located inside the United States. It is estimated these individuals have cost the gaming industry a
estimated 6.2 million dollars in sales.
